newsitem.title: USA: Fed seen adding reserves via overnight system RPs.
newsitem.headline: Fed seen adding reserves via overnight system RPs.

text.p: The Federal Reserve was expected to add reserves to the banking system Tuesday via overnight system repurchase agreements (RPs), economists said.

Monday the Fed added more than $11 billion via overnight and 14-day fixed-system RPs, but economists at UBS Securities Inc. estimated that the Fed's residual quarter-end add need would be sufficient to warrant additional intervention.

The federal funds rate soared as high as 15.0 percent Monday and closed at 9.0 percent as the result of quarter-end pressures. Economists at MMS International said a regional European bank came up short, adding to quarter-end pressures. Funds were last trading at 5-7/8 percent.
